p: All mosquito specimens were divided into 498 pools according to time of collection, location, and mosquito species, and JEV gene detection (qRT-PCR) was performed on each pool. Of 310 pools of C. tritaeniorhynchus, 15 pools collected on 20 August in Tongfu Village, Pingluo County, tested positive for JEV genes ( Table 3, collection site A). In addition, one positive pool was detected from C. tritaeniorhynchus collected in Xinfeng Village, Pingluo County ( Table 3, D collection site) on 26 August. No JEV-positive pools were detected for C. pipiens pallens (76 pools) or A. obturbans (74 pools). The supernatants of all 16 pools of JEV-positive mosquito specimens were inoculated into Vero cells and cultured continuously, but no JEV isolate was obtained.
